question.text:
The steps involved in the mechanism of muscle contraction are given below. Arrange the steps in proper sequential order and select the correct option.

I. Release of calcium ions in the sarcoplasm.
II. Signal sent by the CNS via a motor neuron.
III. Binding of calcium with a subunit of troponin on actin filaments.
IV. Generation of the action potential in the sarcolemma.
V. Binding of myosin head to the exposed active sites on actin to form a cross-bridge.
VI. Inward pulling of 'Z' line attached to actin causing shortening of the sarcomere.
VII. Pulling of the attached actin filaments towards the centre of 'A' band.
VIII. Release of neurotransmitter acetylcholine and generation of the action potential in the sarcolemma.

options.text: III, II, V, I, IV, VI, VII, VIII
II, VIII, IV, I, III, V, VII, VI
I, VIII, VI, II, V, IV, III, VII,
II, IV, V, I, III, VII, VIII, VI

solution.text:
The mechanism of muscle contraction is as follows:

1. Signal sent by the CNS via a motor neuron

2. Release of neurotransmitter acetylcholine and generation of the action potential in the sarcolemma

3. Generation of the action potential in the sarcolemma

4. Release of calcium ions in the sarcoplasm

5. Release of calcium ions in the sarcoplasm

6. Binding of myosin head to the exposed active sites on actin to form a cross-bridge

7. Pulling of the attached actin filaments towards the centre of 'A' band.

8. Inward pulling of 'Z' line attached to actin causing shortening of the sarcomere.
